thread.title: Angels win 2-1 to prevent Rangers from clinching AL West
thread.title_full: Angels win 2-1 to prevent Rangers from clinching AL West

title: Angels win 2-1 to prevent Rangers from clinching AL West
text:
Updated: 11:09 p.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 | Posted: 11:08 p.m. Friday, Oct. 2, 2015 Angels win 2-1 to prevent Rangers from clinching AL West Related View Larger Los Angeles Angels shortstop Erick Aybar (2) tries to turn a double play as Texas Rangers Adrian Beltre slides into second base during the sixth inning of a baseball game in Arlington, Texas, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. Rangers Mitch Moreland was safe at first base. (AP Photo/LM Otero) View Larger Texas Rangers Delino DeShields, bottom slides under third base against Los Angeles Angels third baseman David Freese (6) after DeShields was tagged out trying to steal during the first inning of a baseball game in Arlington, Texas, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. (AP Photo/LM Otero) Los Angeles Angels starting pitcher Jered Weaver throws during the first inning of a baseball game against the Texas Rangers in Arlington, Texas, Friday, Oct. 2, 2015. (AP Photo/LM Otero) By STEPHEN HAWKINS The Associated Press ARLINGTON, Texas â€” 
Mike Trout hit a leadoff triple in the ninth inning and scored on Albert Pujols' tiebreaking single, sending the wild card-contending Los Angeles Angels to a 2-1 win over Texas that kept the Rangers from clinching the AL West title Friday night. 
Rangers closer Shawn Tolleson (6-4) appeared in his fourth consecutive game. Trout hit the second pitch deep into the right-center gap, then slid headfirst into third base before emphatically pumping his right arm toward his teammates in the dugout. 
Pujols followed with a soft single to left field on the next pitch. 
Texas went into Friday already assured a playoff spot, but able to secure the division title with a win over the Angels or a loss by second-place Houston. Copyright The Associated Press
